#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Create a Pour Painting
#Text=Pour paint could be the creative outlet you are looking for .
#Text=Through this fun technique of pouring acrylic paint onto a canvas you will end up with a colorful piece to liven up any space .
#Text=Mix colors and patterns to create your own pour painting .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Preparing Your Workplace
#Text=Prep your working area .
#Text=Find a flat surface and lay some kind plastic or thick cloth to protect it from spills .
#Text=Make sure that you have layers down seeing as the paint spills are an unavoidable part of this project .
#Text=Put on gloves and clothes you do n't mind getting dirty .
#Text=This project requires a lot of paint and it is bound to get messy .
#Text=For a quicker more stress free clean up , make sure to be prepared .
#Text=Prepare your own pour medium .
#Text=The pour medium is an important factor to the pour painting because it is what allows the paints to flow around the canvas without sticking and blending as much .
#Text=It also allows for a vast amount of paint to dry without cracking and creasing .
#Text=Mix a generous amount of white glue and water into a squeeze bottle or container .
#Text=Make sure it is a 50/50 ratio .
#Text=Mix about 3/4 of a cup for a 8x8 in canvas , adjust measurements to size of canvas .
#Text=Prepare paint mix .
#Text=There is going to be a vast amount of paint used in this project .
#Text=To make this more economical , you could go to your local hardware store and ask for samples , or you could buy small amounts of different pigments in bulk at any art supply store .
#Text=To prepare the mix , pour about three table spoons of acrylic paint into a container , then squeeze the pour paint medium from the previous step into the container .
#Text=Mix with a plastic spoon , or some kind of stirrer until it is the consistency of buttermilk .
#Text=Usually a 50/50 ratio does the trick .
#Text=Repeat for all pigments .
#Text=While mixing avoid air bubbles to the best of your abilities .
#Text=Do so by mixing it slowly , do not whisk it or it will turn foamy .
#Text=Prop your canvas on a flat surface .
#Text=Make sure that your work area is covered and materials are ready .
#Text=Creating
#Text=Pour each pigment on canvas slowly .
#Text=While pouring , focus on getting an even amount of pigments over the canvas , it should be in a random fashion .
#Text=Add more of certain pigments to get desired look .
#Text=Pick up canvas and tip it at an angle so that the paint moves around .
#Text=You will not have complete control of where the paint moves but you will be able to steer it into the desired area .
#Text=The excess paint will roll off of the canvas onto the plastic or cloth laid on surface .
#Text=Be very careful while tipping , if the canvas is dropped or something touches the canvas , the paint will move and the image will be distorted .
#Text=Add more paint onto areas that you think need it .
#Text=There is no correct way of making a great piece , just keep on adding until the canvas has no more uncovered spots and you are satisfied .
#Text=Spread paint over any areas that are missing paint with a straight edge .
#Text=An old card or a piece of cardboard will do .
#Text=Lightly swipe paint over area until covered .
#Text=If area can not be covered after two swipes add more paint to area .
#Text=Be careful of not using excess force or swiping too many times .
#Text=This will distort the paint and ruin the illusion of paint dripping down canvas .
#Text=Spray rubbing alcohol over any air bubbles to get rid of them .
#Text=When the canvas is fully covered and you are content with the way it turned out , spray for a more polished look .
#Text=This will also give a bit of visual texture as the alcohol reacts with the paint .
#Text=Let piece sit and dry for up to 36 hours .
#Text=As the paint dries , more unique effects will begin surfacing .
#Text=Make sure it is stored in a safe and dry environment .
#Text=Enjoy your very own pour paint piece !
#Text=There is no other quite like yours , be proud of your creation !
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=8x8 in Canvas
#Text=Plastic or Cloth
#Text=Multiple Acrylic Paints
#Text=Old Card or a Piece of Cardboard
#Text=Multiple Containers Such as Cups
#Text=White Glue
#Text=Stirrer
#Text=Water
#Text=A Flat Surface
#Text=Old Clothes
#Text=Tips
#Text=When picking colors be very conscious that some of the colors may mix , creating a new color .
#Text=Choose colors that create flattering colors when mixed .
#Text=While picking out the paint you do not need to pick up anything very expensive .
#Text=As a beginner it is recommended to get something more economical , perhaps paints in bulk .
#Text=If you are looking to sell pour paints , acrylic paints of better quality would be recommended .
#Text=Tweak measurements depending on size of canvas .
#Text=Make sure everything is really well mixed .
#Text=Be sparing with the paint as you might need some more later .
